title: Day 929
content:
# Day 929

![](https://miro.medium.com/1*Kdyczl-TXnj0sFhXgegFUg.png)

![](https://miro.medium.com/1*fv1VjCVIQCDe8fSwke6nbw.png)

![](https://miro.medium.com/1*cAawxB9ugMyODkDp_S9MWQ.png)

![](https://miro.medium.com/1*Y9RDxqUXnHpoSjCjzzMvQg.png)

![](https://miro.medium.com/1*7g72RQy4pWrEGHlZnSIF0g.png)

There is something really cool about Japanese art. All of these photos were AI generated by me after I saw the photo below.

![](https://miro.medium.com/1*2tYFbYvr0kV2Im3cy_H-vw.png)

The original image struck a chord with me. So much so that I ordered the book even though I know almost nothing about the Author. I can't quite explain it, but the cover just _spoke_ to me. I am reminded why people say a picture is worth a thousand words. Sometimes, a piece of art has the power to bring an unexpected sense of calm, or better yet, a sense of Zen.

10/6/24

Conor Jay Chepenik
